additionalTextInformation.text:
A signature and date were uncovered during the conservation treatment in 1950. However due to the rather stiff execution of the Wolfenbüttel painting the attribution to a copyist after Lucas Cranach was not changed. Furthermore the portrait appears to have the same provenance as a portrait series of reformers created in the 17th century. It has also been observed that on surviving pendants from the Cranach workshop the signature is usually only on the Luther portrait. It is possible that the signature was added later after the painting was separated from its companion piece. 
[Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 78-84, No. 12]

pageContext.description:
A half-length portrait of Katharina von Bora, facing left against a dark brown background and look directly at the viewer. She is wearing a black dress over an undergarment decorated with a border. Her white bonnet is also decorated with black ornamentation, and she has a cream coloured scarf wrapped around her neck and forehead.
[see: Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 78-84, No. 12]
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 38.5 x 28.7 cm
Dimensions including frame: 50.4 x 40.6 cm
[Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 78-84, No. 12]

involvedPersons.suffix: Copy after Lucas Cranach the Elder

pageContext.markings:
on the reverse:
- centre, top: old label: 'Cath. de Bora / Lutheri conjux / picta eod. anno / ubi monasterio / libertata.' 
- centre, bottom: old label: 'Magdalena / Lutheri filia / picta per Lucam Cranach / anno 1523.' and after this in brackets 'error'
- top left: adhesive label with a stamp: 'Herzog August Bibliothek Wolfenbüttel' and inventory no.: 'B93'
- centre, top: collector's seal  
[Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 78-84, No. 12]

pageContext.provenance:
- unknown 
- it has the same collector's seal and frame as the portrait series cat. nos. 20-23, therefore it is assumed that the provenance is the same 
- 1823 first recorded in the library, Wolfenbüttel
[Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 78-84, No. 12]

restorationSurveys.overallAnalysis:
- fine, uniform craquelé
- vertical splits along the joint 
- retouched scratches
- spots of dirt
- small losses and retouches 
[Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 78-84, No. 12]

restorationSurveys.remarks:
'1950 conservation treatment by Fritz Herzig, during which a signature and date were uncovered'
[Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 78-84, No. 12]

tests.text:
- the suport consists of two planks 
- the panel is chamfered at the sides
- battens were added to the left and right sides

- broad battens, light brown bare wood off-set with dark brown, gilded and red moulding 
[Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 78-84, No. 12]

pageContext.signature: Artist's insignia at the left edge: serpent with elevated wings and dated '1528' (probably not authentic)
